channel.title: ItemDump: Dump your Item.cfg into a MySQL database!
channel.description:
This could be used for a Grand Exchange of some sort, or whatever the hell you want, but so far it just inserts the ID of the items and the shopValue of it. If the demand gets big enough I'll make it add more (like bonuses :D)
This was created by me. The only thing that wasn't was the method readItemList() that I used from a current ItemHandler, and took out some things (bonuses on it etc). Originally named loadItemList().
You'll have to edit the db info [db name, user, pass etc] in ItemDump.java.
Execute the following on a database of your choice that you will be using: [code] CREATE TABLE `items` ( `id` int(5), `shopValue` int(10) ); [/code]
ItemDump.java : http://www.rs2reborn.net/dev/ItemDump.java edit info, compile & run. ;)
Average time elapsed: 40-50 seconds for me, that includes reading the item list and inserting into MySQL.
Have fun!

item.title: ItemDump: Dump your Item.cfg into a MySQL database!
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

See, if I understood anything about MySQL, I’d post something constructive and thank you. But since I don’t, I’ll post like a member of this community who is clueless, like normal.

Very Helpful

Read full topic
item.source: ItemDump: Dump your Item.cfg into a MySQL database!

item.title: ItemDump: Dump your Item.cfg into a MySQL database!
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

This could be used for a Grand Exchange of some sort, or whatever the hell you want, but so far it just inserts the ID of the items and the shopValue of it. If the demand gets big enough I’ll make it add more (like bonuses :D)

This was created by me. The only thing that wasn’t was the method readItemList() that I used from a current ItemHandler, and took out some things (bonuses on it etc). Originally named loadItemList().

You’ll have to edit the db info [db name, user, pass etc] in ItemDump.java.

Execute the following on a database of your choice that you will be using:

CREATE TABLE `items` (
`id` int(5),
`shopValue` int(10)
);

ItemDump.java : http://www.rs2reborn.net/dev/ItemDump.java
edit info, compile & run.

Average time elapsed: 40-50 seconds for me, that includes reading the item list and inserting into MySQL.

Have fun!

Read full topic
